This version puts your History in a separate tab within Up Next, making it easier than ever to close Up Next by dragging it down (and to browse your History).

Also included: many bug fixes and improvements. Read all about them below:

• Album artwork size on album grids is now proportional to the size of your screen, which means you can now see more at once on smaller iPhones, or enjoy even bigger art on Plus devices
• The album grid on Artist pages can now be scrolled with more freedom, making it easier to browse an artist's albums
• Fixed: While using Pull to Search on smaller devices, the tab selector would get distorted
• Improved the reliability and visual consistency of Up Next
• Fixed: When adding and playing a song that had already been part of the play queue, the queue playhead would revert back to the position of the first instance of the song and continue playing from there. The queue would then continue on until it reaches the duplicate song again, causing a loop in the play queue. I know it sounds confusing, but believe me, you're glad this is now fixed.
• Clarified some copy on the English and Spanish localizations

Thanks for using Doppi. If you're enjoying the app, share it with a friend who might enjoy it too :)

Search from anywhere
Pull down from anywhere in your library to bring up the brand-new Search interface.

Fully refreshed design
Every corner of Doppi has been reimagined for clarity and consistency.

Re-engineered library
Truly a brain transplant that opens doors to great new features in the future.

Plus, some nice details:
• Support for Dynamic Type – Doppi will now adapt to whatever your Text Size system setting is
• Search Top Hit – Pressing the Return key will now trigger the top hit in Search, no need to reach up
• Repeat One – You can allow Repeat One from Preferences, and activate it by tapping the Repeat button

Doppi 2.4.4 fixes:
• some songs not appearing in an artist's list
• Up Next not showing anything after opening the app
• now playing indicator not showing up inside albums
and more!

Here's something that happens to me pretty often: I'm shuffling my music, and a song from a great album comes up. The album is so good that I want to keep listening to it instead of the shuffle, but I don't want to stop listening to the song—I just want the album to continue playing from that song after it ends.

Doppi can do that! Just go to the album while the song is playing, press Play at the top, and select Continue Album. The song won't skip a beat, and the rest of the album will play from that song forward, with repeat enabled, so you can listen to the beginning as well. I think it's pretty neat.

Enjoy, and share Doppi with a friend who loves music too!

—Radu

• A gentle reminder about the availability of these icons — and of your ability to tip me for my incredible (and unhealthy) dedication to this beautiful app!

There are fun times in the horizon. A long-requested feature is coming. I'm not saying what, but I'll give you a hint: it's a bunch of lists that you can play. Oh, dang. Guess that wasn't so hard. Well, it's coming!

Enjoy.

Doppi 4.1.4:
• Fixes a crash that could occur while generating artwork
• Fixes a crash that occurred in certain navigation scenarios
• Includes many other fixes and improvements

Doppi now requires iOS 12. There's no good reason for this, other than Xcode encouraged it. I checked, and all iOS 11 devices can also run iOS 12, so there's that. If there's a reason why you're holding on to 11, let me know.

Enjoy!

• Correct reading of Album Artist on all imported files

Enjoy.
